multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates, FX; US tariff shock and BoE rate cut shift inflation expectations and yield curves, pushing DXY lower and widening UK‑US rate differential.

category.motivation: The article reports the implementation of new U.S. tariffs on semiconductor imports and other goods, constituting a regulatory change affecting trade policy.

impact.motivation: Insufficient information about the specific node to determine relevance of the tariff and BoE rate cut news.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports on newly implemented tariffs and immediate market reactions, as well as BoE rate cut expectations, which are short‑term events.

article_node.title: Higher Tariffs Take Effect, New 100% Levy on Chips; BOE Set to Cut
article_node.summary: U.S. tariffs have taken effect, with a 100% levy on semiconductor imports (exempting companies that shift production to the U.S.) and a 39% tariff on Swiss goods, while India’s tariffs doubled to 50%. The news has boosted tech stocks such as TSMC and Samsung, and lifted Asian markets. Meanwhile, the Bank of England is expected to cut rates to its lowest level in two years as it grapples with a slowing economy and sticky inflation.
